name: EDA Data Analyst Intern
description:
NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make lives easier, better, and safer. As the world leader in secure connectivity solutions for embedded applications, NXP is driving innovation in the automotive, industrial & IoT, mobile, and communication infrastructure markets. Built on more than 60 years of combined experience and expertise, the company has over 29,000 employees in more than 30 countries and posted revenue of $8.88 billion in 2019.

NXP Moscow is recruiting an intern Data Analyst for our Design Enablement organization. The mission of the Design Enablement organization is to work closely with product design teams to define and develop advanced Electronic Design Automation (EDA) flows and methodologies, and disseminate best known methods to support NXP product design world-wide. In this position, you will work with an international NXP team as a data analyst to optimize NXP’s IC design flow.

Main responsibilities:

  • Learn and understand EDA requirements for NXP design projects
  • Work with the global Design Enablement team and with EDA vendors to develop and improve EDA flows
  • Use Data Science skills to analyze and optimize NXP’s IC design flow

Minimal requirements:

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent and currently enrolled in a master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Programming skills such as Python
  • Strong basis of statistics or data analysis concepts
  • Familiarity with data analytics topics and related software tools (e.g., Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Jupyter Notebook, Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch)
  • Experience working in the Linux environment, and using Linux utilities (e.g., make, awk, bash scripting) is preferred
  • An analytical thinker with problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Possesses communication, interpersonal, and teaching skills
  • Enjoys working in a fast-paced, multi-project, international team using state of the art tools and technology
  • Written and verbal communication skills in English enough to communicate with colleagues and EDA tool users throughout the global company

We offer:

  • Development opportunities in an industry leading company
  • Technical mentoring program
  • NXP Russia office location: Zelenograd
